workflow.name: Generate automated social media reports with GPT-4o, Twitter, Facebook & Notion
workflow.description:
## Description
Automate your weekly social media analytics with this end-to-end AI reporting workflow. üìäü§ñ
 This system collects real-time Twitter (X) and Facebook metrics, merges and validates data, formats it with JavaScript, generates an AI-powered HTML report via GPT-4o, saves structured insights in Notion, and shares visual summaries via Slack and Gmail. Perfect for marketing teams tracking engagement trends and performance growth. üöÄüí¨

## What This Template Does
 1Ô∏è‚É£ Starts manually or on-demand to fetch the latest analytics data. üïπÔ∏è
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Retrieves follower, engagement, and post metrics from both X (Twitter) and Facebook APIs. üê¶üìò
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Merges and validates responses to ensure clean, complete datasets. üîç
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Runs custom JavaScript to normalize and format metrics into a unified JSON structure. üß©
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Uses Azure OpenAI GPT-4o to generate a visually rich HTML performance report with tables, emojis, and insights. üß†üìà
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Saves the processed analytics into a Notion ‚ÄúGrowth Chart‚Äù database for centralized trend tracking. üóÇÔ∏è
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Sends an email summary report to the marketing team, complete with formatted HTML insights. üìß
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Posts a concise Slack update comparing platform performance and engagement deltas. üí¨
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Logs any validation or API errors automatically into Google Sheets for debugging and traceability. üßæ

## Key Benefits
 ‚úÖ Centralizes all social metrics into a single automated flow.
 ‚úÖ Delivers AI-generated HTML reports ready for email and dashboard embedding.
 ‚úÖ Reduces manual tracking with Notion and Slack syncs.
 ‚úÖ Ensures data reliability with built-in validation and error logging.
 ‚úÖ Gives instant, visual insights for weekly marketing reviews.

## Features
- Multi-platform analytics integration (Twitter X + Facebook Graph API).
- JavaScript node for dynamic data normalization.
- Azure OpenAI GPT-4o for HTML report generation.
- Notion database update for long-term trend storage.
- Slack and Gmail nodes for instant sharing and communication.
- Automated error capture to Google Sheets for workflow reliability.
- Visual, emoji-enhanced reporting with HTML formatting and insights.

## Requirements
- Twitter OAuth2 API credentials for access to public metrics.
- Facebook Graph API access token for page insights.
- Azure OpenAI API key for GPT-4o report generation.
- Notion API credentials with write access to ‚ÄúGrowth Chart‚Äù database.
- Gmail OAuth2 credentials for report dispatch.
- Slack Bot Token with chat:write permission for posting analytics summaries.
- Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials for maintaining the error log.

## Environment Variables
TWITTER_API_KEY
FACEBOOK_ACCESS_TOKEN
AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY
NOTION_GROWTH_DB_ID
GMAIL_REPORT_RECIPIENTS
SLACK_REPORT_CHANNEL_ID
GOOGLE_SHEET_ERROR_LOG_ID

## Target Audience
 üìà Marketing and growth teams tracking cross-platform performance
 üí° Social media managers needing automated reporting
 üß† Data analysts compiling weekly engagement metrics
 üí¨ Digital agencies managing multiple brand accounts
 üßæ Operations and analytics teams monitoring performance KPIs

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
 1Ô∏è‚É£ Connect all API credentials (Twitter, Facebook, Notion, Gmail, Slack, and Sheets).
 2Ô∏è‚É£ Paste your Facebook Page ID and Twitter handle in respective API nodes.
 3Ô∏è‚É£ Verify your Azure OpenAI GPT-4o connection and prompt text for HTML report generation.
 4Ô∏è‚É£ Update your Notion database structure to match ‚ÄúGrowth Chart‚Äù property names.
 5Ô∏è‚É£ Add your marketing email in the Gmail node and test delivery.
 6Ô∏è‚É£ Specify the Slack channel ID where summaries will be posted.
 7Ô∏è‚É£ Optionally, connect a Google Sheet tab for error tracking (error_id, message).
 8Ô∏è‚É£ Execute the workflow once manually to validate data flow.
 9Ô∏è‚É£ Activate or schedule it for weekly or daily analytics automation. ‚úÖ

options.systemMessage:
=You are a social media analytics assistant specialized in crafting performance reports.

Your goal is to transform raw metrics into engaging, data-driven summaries.

Guidelines:
- Write in a confident, analytical tone.
- Present key metrics in HTML tables with subtle color cues.
- Highlight positive performance with green, weak metrics with orange/red.
- Avoid marketing fluff; focus on clarity and visual readability.
- Use emojis to make sections visually distinct (üìä, üê¶, üìò, üìà).
- Include a short conclusion motivating the user to keep improving.

nodes.name: Send Email Summary to Marketing Team

parameters.subject: =üìä Weekly Social Media Performance Report ‚Äî Twitter & Facebook Overview

parameters.text:
=üì¢ *Social Media Performance Report*

üê¶ *Twitter ‚Äî *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.twitter.name }}
‚Ä¢ Username: `{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.twitter.username }}`
‚Ä¢ Followers: *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.twitter.followers }}*
‚Ä¢ Following: *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.twitter.following }}*
‚Ä¢ Tweets: *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.twitter.tweets }}*
‚Ä¢ Likes: *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.twitter.likes }}*
‚Ä¢ Media Posts: *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.twitter.media }}*

üìò *Facebook ‚Äî {{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.facebook.name }}*
‚Ä¢ Followers: *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.facebook.followers }}*
‚Ä¢ Likes: *{{ $(' Normalize & Format Social Data (JavaScript)').item.json.facebook.likes }}*

üìä *Summary Insight:*
{{ 
  $json.twitter.followers > $json.facebook.followers 
    ? "üöÄ Twitter shows stronger engagement this week!" 
    : "‚ö†Ô∏è Facebook performance is lagging, needs attention."
}}

üóìÔ∏è _Auto-generated by Social Analytics Bot at {{ $now }}_

parameters.content:
## Cross-Platform Growth Tracker üöÄ  
This workflow automatically tracks and reports weekly follower and engagement growth across Twitter (X) and Facebook.

It aggregates key metrics, generates a styled HTML summary via GPT-4o, logs data to Notion for historical tracking, and posts performance updates to Slack and email.

### Key Highlights:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Fetches follower and like counts from both platforms.  
2Ô∏è‚É£ Validates data integrity and logs any errors to Google Sheets.  
3Ô∏è‚É£ Normalizes metrics into unified JSON (Twitter + Facebook).  
4Ô∏è‚É£ Generates a professional HTML summary report.  
5Ô∏è‚É£ Updates Notion ‚ÄúGrowth Chart‚Äù database for archival tracking.  
6Ô∏è‚É£ Sends report via Gmail and posts summary to Slack.

### Setup Checklist:
- Connect all credentials: Twitter, Facebook Graph, Notion, Azure OpenAI, Gmail, Google Sheets, Slack.  
- Update Notion Database ID and email recipients.  
- Customize Slack user/channel if needed.  
- Schedule to run automatically (weekly or daily).

## Data Fetching Layer  
Fetches live analytics data from Twitter (X) and Facebook Graph API.  
Captures follower count, likes, tweets/posts, and media uploads for both platforms.  
Provides the raw input for normalization and comparison.

## Dataset Merging  
Merges Twitter and Facebook API responses into a unified dataset.  
Maintains key engagement fields and creates a standardized structure ready for validation.

## Data Validation Layer  
Ensures both API responses contain valid data.  
If missing or invalid, logs the issue to Google Sheets and prevents incomplete processing.

## Normalization & Formatting  
Cleans, renames, and structures merged data into JSON objects under `twitter` and `facebook` keys.  
Ensures consistent field naming and metric availability for AI summarization.

## AI Report Generation (GPT-4o)  
GPT-4o transforms normalized data into a visually styled HTML email summary.  
Includes:
- Total reach overview  
- Platform comparison tables  
- Emoji-based insights  
- Growth trends & improvement suggestions  
Output is formatted with inline CSS for Gmail compatibility.

## Data Storage in Notion  
Saves structured Twitter and Facebook metrics in the ‚ÄúGrowth Chart‚Äù Notion database.  
Creates historical records for growth visualization and long-term trend tracking.

## Slack Announcement  
Posts a summary message to the Slack user/channel with weekly metrics and platform comparison.  
Includes emoji-based insights such as ‚ÄúüöÄ Twitter shows stronger engagement‚Äù or ‚Äú‚ö†Ô∏è Facebook performance is lagging.‚Äù

## Email Dispatch  
Sends the HTML performance report to the marketing team via Gmail.  
Subject: ‚Äúüìä Weekly Social Media Performance Report ‚Äî Twitter & Facebook Overview.‚Äù  
Ensures consistent delivery of visually formatted weekly summaries.

## Error Logging  
Captures workflow or API errors and logs them into Google Sheets.  
Allows ongoing monitoring of API response reliability and workflow health.

main.node: Send Email Summary to Marketing Team

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
